hack-fest.name: Hack Fest
hack-fest.shortDescription: A 24-hour hackathon to innovate and create solutions.
hack-fest.description: Hack Fest is a 24-hour hackathon where participants come together to innovate and create solutions to real-world problems. Teams will work on their projects, present their ideas, and compete for exciting prizes. This event is perfect for tech enthusiasts and problem solvers.
rules: Participants must bring their laptops for hands-on exercises.
Basic knowledge of programming is recommended.
Certificates will be provided upon completion.

workshop-plc.name: Workshop-1 PLC
workshop-plc.shortDescription: WORKSHOP – PLC Essentials: From Theory to Practice
workshop-plc.description: The Workshop-1 PLC provides an introduction to Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs). Participants will learn about PLC programming, hardware configuration, and practical applications in industrial automation.
rules: Participants must bring their laptops for hands-on exercises.
Basic knowledge of programming is recommended.
Certificates will be provided upon completion.

workshop-ros.name: Workshop-2 ROS
workshop-ros.shortDescription: ROS for Absolute Beginners: Basics on Navigation
workshop-ros.description: Join the Workshop-2 ROS to dive into the world of robotics. This workshop offers hands-on experience with the Robot Operating System (ROS), covering essential concepts, programming, and real-world applications. Perfect for aspiring roboticists and engineers.
rules: Participants must solve problems within the given time frame.
Internet access is allowed only for research purposes.
Plagiarism or copying code from others will lead to disqualification.

project-expo.name: Project Expo
project-expo.shortDescription: Showcase your innovative projects to industry experts.
project-expo.description: The Project Expo is a platform for aspiring innovators to present their groundbreaking projects. Participants will have the opportunity to showcase their work to industry experts, receive valuable feedback, and compete for exciting prizes.
rules: Each team must submit a business plan document before the event.
Presentations should not exceed 15 minutes.
Judging criteria include feasibility, innovation, and presentation skills.

paper-presentation.name: Paper Presentation
paper-presentation.shortDescription: Present your research and innovative ideas.
paper-presentation.description: The Paper Presentation event provides a platform for researchers and students to present their innovative ideas and research findings. Participants will have the opportunity to showcase their work, receive feedback from experts, and compete for recognition and prizes. Topics include:
topics: Autonomous Mobile Robots in Industrial Logistics
Cyber security in a Connected World
rules: Participants must bring their own laptops.
Pre-requisites include basic knowledge of networking and programming.
Certification will be provided upon completion.

sumo-bot.name: Sumo Bot
sumo-bot.shortDescription: Battle your robots in the ultimate Sumo showdown.
sumo-bot.description: The Sumo Bot competition challenges participants to design and build robots that can compete in a Sumo-style arena. Teams will battle their robots against each other, aiming to push their opponents out of the ring. This event tests creativity, engineering skills, and strategic thinking.
rules: All teams must submit their design proposal before the event.
The robot must be built within the specified size and weight constraints.
Teams will have one practice session before the competition begins.

robo-race.name: Robo Race
robo-race.shortDescription: Race your robots to victory in an exciting competition.
robo-race.description: The Robo Race event challenges participants to design and build fast, agile robots capable of navigating a complex racecourse. Teams will compete to see whose robot can complete the course in the shortest time, testing their engineering skills and creativity.
rules: Participants must register individually.
Match formats and game titles will be announced on the day of the event.
Fair play and sportsmanship are mandatory.

line-following-robot.name: Line Following Robot
line-following-robot.shortDescription: Build and program robots to follow a line autonomously.
line-following-robot.description: The Line Following Robot event challenges participants to design and program robots that can autonomously follow a line on a track. Teams will compete to see whose robot can navigate the course with the highest speed and accuracy, testing their skills in robotics and programming.
rules: Participants should bring a sketchpad or digital device for design.
Basic knowledge of design software is recommended.
Certificates will be provided upon completion.

robo-soccer.name: Robo Soccer
robo-soccer.shortDescription: Compete in a thrilling soccer match with your robots.
robo-soccer.description: The Robo Soccer event invites participants to design and build robots capable of playing soccer. Teams will compete in exciting matches, showcasing their robots' agility, strategy, and teamwork. This event combines engineering, programming, and sportsmanship in a fun and competitive environment.
rules: Performances should not exceed 5 minutes.
Participants must provide their own instruments.
Judging will be based on creativity, skill, and stage presence.

drone-shoot.name: Drone Shoot
drone-shoot.shortDescription: Capture breathtaking aerial footage with your drone.
drone-shoot.description: Experience a new perspective on our campus! Drone Shoot is a dynamic event where participants use drones equipped with cameras to capture stunning aerial footage of our campus. Showcase your technical skills and creative vision by submitting a finalized video that highlights our campus from above. Join us to elevate your perspective—register now and bring your aerial vision to life!
rules: Participants must complete a pre-workshop assignment.
Basic knowledge of 3D modeling is beneficial.
All designs must be original.

maze-solver.name: Maze Solver
maze-solver.shortDescription: Program your robot to navigate and solve a complex maze.
maze-solver.description: The Maze Solver event challenges participants to design and program robots that can autonomously navigate through a complex maze. Teams will compete to see whose robot can find the exit in the shortest time, testing their skills in robotics, programming, and problem-solving.
rules: Participants must adhere to safety guidelines.
Drones must meet the specified technical requirements.
Any damage to the track will result in disqualification.
